resources.string: "a sharp increase in the rate of cryptocurrencies (“flight to the moon”). "

"a loan that a broker can provide to a client to purchase securities backed by assets held in the client's account. Although credit can be provided not only in cash, but also in the form of securities, this term is usually used to refer to long positions opened on credit. Shoulder width is measured in relation to the size of the client account. For example: leverage of 2 to 1 means the possibility of obtaining 2 dollars of credit for 1 dollar of existing assets. "
"mass purchase of cryptocurrency, aimed at artificial appreciation. "

"a phenomenon that usually occurs when a stock price falls (grows) sharply, when the price reaches a strong support (resistance) level, leads to an increase in buying (selling). As a result, the fall (growth) is temporarily suspended and the price rises (falls) somewhat from the levels reached, as if bouncing off like a ball. Then the movement of quotes resumes in the direction preceding the rebound. If such a continuation of the movement does not occur, then the rebound turns into a reversal. Unlike bounce, the term \"dead cat jump\" only refers to the situation where the bounce occurs during cushioning. "
"these are traders who play on the downside of the price and deliberately reduce it to a minimum. "
"a sharp drop in the cryptocurrency rate, indicated in red on the chart. "
"these are key exchange players who own a large amount of cryptocurrency and influence the market. "
"this is a kind of digital currency, accounting for internal units of account of which is provided by a decentralized payment system operating in a fully automatic mode. "

"important information that can affect stock quotes, but is available at the time of its appearance only to a narrow circle of people - insiders. Insiders use this information to their advantage until it becomes available to other participants. "
"the rapid growth of the cryptocurrency rate, marked in green on the chart. "
"intentionally selling cryptocurrencies in gigantic quantities to artificially depreciate "

"a significant gap, a jump in quotes. Usually happens between the price of the morning open and the previous evening close of the market. Occurs in the event of a change in the market situation during the time until the auction was held. "

"Unlike a trend, a sideways movement characterizes the movement of the market without a clearly defined direction. Quotes move as if sideways, flat - smooth (eng.). However, a really even sidewall is quite rare. "
traders playing on the increase in the prices of crypto-currencies
"a decentralized database that is simultaneously stored on many computers connected to each other on the Internet. The word \"blockchain\" is translated from English as \"chain of blocks\". "
"it is any cryptocurrency launched after bitcoin. Simply put, altcoins, of which there are already hundreds of varieties, act as improved alternatives to bitcoin. "
